content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `ispersonal` that returns a trait if the provided Vehicle type is a personal vehicle for everyday driving. All vehicles are subtypes of AbstractVehicle. Function must work for types: Car, Motorcycle, Bus, Truck. The first two should return true, the latter two should return false . The function should default to false for any other subtype of AbstractVehicle. Provide an example.

Sure! Here is a way you can solve this problem in Julia:

```julia
abstract type AbstractVehicle end
abstract type PersonalVehicle <: AbstractVehicle end
abstract type NonPersonalVehicle <: AbstractVehicle end

struct Car <: PersonalVehicle end
struct Motorcycle <: PersonalVehicle end
struct Bus <: NonPersonalVehicle end
struct Truck <: NonPersonalVehicle end

ispersonal(::Type{Car}) = true
ispersonal(::Type{Motorcycle}) = true
ispersonal(::Type{Bus}) = false
ispersonal(::Type{Truck}) = false
ispersonal(t::Type) = false # default condition for any other subtype of AbstractVehicle
```
Here's an example usage:
```julia
julia> ispersonal(Car)
true

julia> ispersonal(Motorcycle)
true

julia> ispersonal(Bus)
false

julia> ispersonal(Truck)
false

julia> ispersonal(typeof(Car)) # using type instead of instance
true
```
In this example, `ispersonal` function checks if the provided Vehicle type is a subtype of PersonalVehicle. If it's not, then it will return false by default.
